messages.message:
Hi there, want to continue discussion on the point I brought on today backend case field meeting.

My question was:
â€¢ If we imagine our system 1 year from now (or if we redesign it from scratch), would we still want to have 2 of everything? (Like UDFs for single class and for cross class, validations for single class and cross class, prompts for a single class and cross class...) Or should we think (and implement) about them as a same functionality which applies to a different scope for different fields?
If I redesign our system, I'd probably have scopes, each one included in the next one: EXTRACTION_SCOPE -> CLASS_SCOPE -> DOCUMENT_SCOPE -> PACKET_SCOPE and allow dependencies only on lower scope (or lower level of a current scope). With that execution of a workflow will be a rather clean one: do calculation and validation for each scope in the order and it also will allow us to parallelize calculations and validations for each scope layer.
(Note about layers: we can calculate layers inside a scope during app compilation and build execution using Dijkstra-like approach and failing if we have circular dependencies instead of relying on the field position. Also cleaning for a field will be in a separate (next) layer from the field, any dependent fields will be in at least next layer, all validation will be on the very last layer)

I believe this will allow us to simplify API and implementation a lot

WDYT?
cc @pauline.comising @ayesha.ali since you have more context
